reasoning: Familial (genetic) forms account for ~30-50% of dilated cardiomyopathy cases. Estimated incidence ~2-3 per 100k based on familial proportion of DCM. Lower confidence due to limited specific epidemiological data for familial subset.
source: Mestroni L et al. (1999). Familial dilated cardiomyopathy: evidence for genetic and phenotypic heterogeneity. J Am Coll Cardiol. 34(1):181-90
